issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:

issue.title: vincenzosplate.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
3. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
4. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
5. Tap to install
6. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
7. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VW5dWUbwFtc&list=RD8Nt9YPnYyjs&index=12](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DVW5dWUbwFtc%26list%3DRD8Nt9YPnYyjs%26index%3D12) ### Comment > My problem right now is that when I try to play a video, it shows "This content isn't available, try again later." thing. When I refresh the page it plays the video, which is fine. The issue lies with the fact that if I pause the adguard protection, It plays the video normally. > I pretty much tested it a couple times to see if it was just youtube being stupid but no, it actually is smart enough now that it somehow cracked down on you guy's. > The steps that I got to that is the first picture shown, whenever I play any type of video except shorts is when it shows the content thing, If you refresh the page things go back to normal. [the last picture shown is after the refresh] > I did this multiple times and it's pretty consistent every time. > I then go and disable adblocker and then go to a different type of video to see whether that changed or not, which it did made a difference, just with the exception of waiting for the ad to pass by. > And the middle image is something I thought I showed you since there is an ad there, If I were to refresh the page it would inevitably become the "This content isn't available, try again later." thing. > > Find new video> See Content thing> Refresh page> Normal youtube video. > > Disable Adblocker> Find a new Video> See ad and wait> Normal video. > > Basically that's how it goes, More of a straightforward response. > I normally don't do these but I thought I would make a report and hopefully you guy's see this. > > Hope you guys have a great day and hope to never write another report. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/dt3wbffd44gg0ogcs8k8k4scw88s0ogh3i0bwax2w8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/km0603kb0xs0cscosc0s4cgggcgk4colz0gf7kw1sg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 3 ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5u81pnj6hd0k4ow8wkk884kko4wggkosju6prtas2o.png?nc=1)

issue.title: newspicks.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://newspicks.com/news/15895726/?ref=user_1304243](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewspicks.com%2Fnews%2F15895726%2F%3Fref%3Duser_1304243) ### Comment > This website is designed to highlight the selected user's comments based on the ?ref=user_xxxxxxx part of the URL. So when the ref is removed as a tracking parameter, I can no longer see the selected user's comments. > > I confirmed that the following user rule can solve it. > `@@||newspicks.com^$removeparam=ref` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/isud2vrfhios8s0c0ko0wgwos0coc40juwhoff6ytc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/8zfcy7oujhssgsokgwg0soww0kkswo8en9kjlqueeg.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.12.2 System version: | `Android 16` Browser: | Chrome License type: | paid AdGuard mode: | VPN HTTPS filtering: | enabled Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320)

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests DNS filtering: | server: `System`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/android/filters/15_optimized.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Mobile Ads,
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard URL Tracking,
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Widgets,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners

Security:
Online Malicious URL Blocklist

Language-specific:
AdGuard Japanese Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | `https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.meta.js` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=and&product_version=4.12.2&system_version=Android+16&browser=chrome&filters=11.208.19.4.17.18.3.22.2.21.7.20&dns_servers=System&userscripts=https%253A%252F%252Fuserscripts.adtidy.org%252Frelease%252Fadguard-extra%252F1.0%252Fadguard-extra.meta.js&android.mode=VPN&android.system_root=false&dns.filters=https%253A%252F%252Ffilters.adtidy.org%252Fandroid%252Ffilters%252F15_optimized.txt&dns.filters_enabled=true&dns.enabled=true&https.filtering=true&browsing_security.enabled=true&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=true&stealth.webrtc=false&stealth.push=false&stealth.location=false&stealth.strip_url=true&stealth.hide_search_queries=true&stealth.DNT=true&stealth.x_client=true&stealth.dpi=false&stealth.third_party_cookies=180&stealth.first_party_cookies=4320&stealth.disable_third_party_cache=false&stealth.block_third_party_auth=false&stealth.block_trackers=true&license_type=paid&dns.timeout=5000)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://newspicks.com/news/15895726/?ref=user_1304243](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewspicks.com%2Fnews%2F15895726%2F%3Fref%3Duser_1304243) ### Comment > This website is designed to highlight the selected user's comments based on the ?ref=user_xxxxxxx part of the URL. So when the ref is removed as a tracking parameter, I can no longer see the selected user's comments. > > I confirmed that the following user rule can solve it. > `@@||newspicks.com^$removeparam=ref` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/isud2vrfhios8s0c0ko0wgwos0coc40juwhoff6ytc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/8zfcy7oujhssgsokgwg0soww0kkswo8en9kjlqueeg.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.12.2 System version: | `Android 16` Browser: | Chrome License type: | paid AdGuard mode: | VPN HTTPS filtering: | enabled Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320)

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests DNS filtering: | server: `System`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/android/filters/15_optimized.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973
